definition: person in power/the one with authority/the guy in charge

sentences.english: For centuries, Chinese wealth and power dwarfed the West’s.
sentences.chinese: 在好几个世纪里，中国的财富和权势傲视西方。

sentences.english: He is obsequious to men in power.
However Zhong Ning's ascendancy and fortune do not have conquer poplar luck.
sentences.chinese: 然而钟宁的权势与财富没有征服杨瑞。

sentences.english: We didn't like him, as he fawned on anyone in an influential position.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢他，因为他爱巴结有权势的人。

sentences.english: Power really is a test of character.
sentences.chinese: 权势的确是一种品格的试练。

sentences.english: Don't toady to or be obsequious to rich or powerful people.
sentences.chinese: 不谄媚奉承有钱或权势的人。

sentences.english: The ideal targets are cultural celebrities and minor officials.
sentences.chinese: 他们最喜欢的目标是名星和无多大权势的小官。

sentences.english: Power is the shackle to shackle itself while love is the emancipator to emancipate itself.
sentences.chinese: 权势是禁锢自己的镣铐，爱情是解放自己的救星。

sentences.english: Because of her findings, the movent to end the powerful monopolies was greatly sengthened.
sentences.chinese: 由于她的发现，大大加强告终束独有垄断运动的权势。

sentences.english: Christ had defeated the powers of evil, and death lost its grip on him.
sentences.chinese: 基督已战胜罪恶的权势，而死亡也不能再拑制祂。

sentences.english: The writhings of power lie in that he cannot make its victims writhe.
sentences.chinese: 权势者的苦恼就在于不能令其受害者感到苦恼。

sentences.english: He also has a reputation for revelling in the power and glamour his position brings.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔好炫耀地位给他带来的权势和风光也是有名的。

sentences.english: And a man was killed since ancient times in the reign of battlefield, seize power.
sentences.chinese: 而男人自古就是杀死战场，腥风血雨中夺取权势。

sentences.english: In ancient Rome, the most powerful citizens were called "the ones who wear red.
sentences.chinese: 在古罗马，最有权势的公民被称作“穿红衣的人”。

sentences.english: He saves us from the power of sin.
sentences.chinese: 他救我们脱离了罪的权势。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith is a man of influence in this town.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生是这个镇上有权势的人物。

definition: to be in a position of power
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
